clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Structured Education to Decrease Blood Pressure for Hypertension in Elderly
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Structured Education to Decrease Blood Pressure for Hypertension in Elderly : a Randomized Controlled Trial

oversight_info.authority: Indonesia: National Agency of Drug and Food Control

brief_summary.textblock: There is a structured educational effect on blood pressure reduction in elderly hypertensive patients.

detailed_description.textblock:
Eligibility criteria are men and women over 60 years old and available to participate in the study for 3 months with blood pressure higher than 140/90.
Exclusion criteria are severe dementia, malignant hypertension, depression
Outcome measures are systolic and diastolic blood pressure after 3 months administration of structured education once a month.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.description: We aim to measure the difference in systolic blood pressure after 3 months administration structured education in elderly with hypertension

secondary_outcome.description: We measure the difference of diastolic blood pressure after 3 Months administration of structured education in elderly with hypertension

arm_group.description: Formatted education and checklist every month for 3 months
Formatted education every month for 3 months

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject with age more than 60 years
- Blood pressure higher than 140/90
Exclusion Criteria:
- Severe Dementia
- Depression
- Malignant Hypertension
